name: 1.1 - The current revision drawings are being used including subcontractors copy.
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawing is being used (including the subcontractors copy). Current revision to be obtained via Aconex or ACC
Reference Documents - Drawings and drawing registers
Record of conformity - Up to date drawing sets and this ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls being implemented, that is CEMP, TMP, SWMS, & WP
Reference Documents - CEMP, TMP, SWMS, & WP
Record of conformity - Site and office Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Excavation Permit issued by APAM obtained prior to any excavation on site.
Record of conformity - Proof of & permit ITP sign
○ Test Certificates demonstrating compliance of the reinforcement with the requirements of AS 3600
○ Mix design to be submitted to contract administrator for review and acceptance.
○ Concrete curing regime to be reviewed and approved by the contract administrator prior to use
Acceptance Criteria - Setout completed and conformance with Beca IFC Drawings.
○ Excavation depth shall be as per specified or as shown on Drawings to accommodate structures.
○ Principals representative to be notified for at the completion of excavations for inspection prior to any blinding being poured.
Reference Documents - Specifications as per Drawings
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
○ Completion of excavation and inspection of subgrade materials.
○ No soft spots, unsuitable material. Confirm ground bearing pressure
○ Density Testing to be carried put at a minimum of 1 Test for each 100m2 area per layer of compacted excavations for footings & concrete works
Record of conformity - DCP Test Results
Acceptance Criteria - Blinding layer is installed as per drawings
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Formwork / Reverse Shall conform to shapes, lines, levels and dimensions of the concrete shown or indicated on the Drawings.
Reference Documents - Specifications as per Drawings
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Penetrations/cast in items are present in the formwork.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
○ Position and spacing check and recorded.
Record of conformity - Pre-pour inspection List CLA31A
5.0 - Pre-pour Planning and Inspections and Placement (1st Pour)
○ Superintendent or Engineer to conduct pre-pour inspection prior to concrete pour
○ Principals representative to inspect formwork and steel fixing
Record of conformity - Pre-pour inspection List CLA31A
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete shall be placed within 90mins from batching.
○ All concrete supplied for concrete structures shall be subject to project control testing in accordance with AS 1379.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Composite samples to be taken in accordance with AS 1012.1.
○ 2 – 7 Day cylinder and 2 – 28 day cylinders to be taken.
○ Frequency of testing shall be one sample taken either every 50m3 or once per day, whichever yields a higher frequency.
Reference Documents - Drawing 00201 Note 51. AS 1012.1, AS 1012.9
Record of conformity - Concrete Testers Sheet/Results
Acceptance Criteria - Slump test is required for each load per day
Record of conformity - Concrete Testers Sheet/Results
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete to be vibrated to ensure compaction and air voids removed. Screed finish required on exposed surfaces.
○ Concrete shall be moist cured or coated by an approved curing compound for a period not less than seven days unless approved by the Superintendent.
Record of conformity - This Signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Forms shall remain and be maintained firmly in place until the concrete has attained the necessary strength to support its own weight.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Review of 7 day and 28 day test certificates

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
1.0 - Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Survey Documentation
1.1 - The current revision drawings are being used including subcontractors copy.
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawing is being used including the subcontractors copy.
○ Current Revision to be obtained via Aconex
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls.
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, WP SWMS
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Area has been surveyed, highlighting any areas where excavations should not occur (e.g. exclusion zone).
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, WP SWMS
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Source Rock shall comply with VicRoads Specification 801
○ Crushed Rock shall comply with VicRoads Specification 812. The contractor shall provide test certificates confirming that the supplied crushed rock meets this specification
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Material Test Certificates

Acceptance Criteria - Place in horizontal layers of approximately equal thickness. The loose thickness layer shall not exceed 300mm UNO, and in any case, shall not exceed the depth for which satisfactory compaction can be achieved
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - During placement of the material check;

○ Where engineered fill is used to construct permanent batters, it shall be overfilled, compacted, and cut back to the dimensions, levels and design grades to ensure that the final batters have the required compaction
○ Place in a manner such that handling and spreading of materials does not produce gradation of the materials
○ Place so that the surface is always self-draining
○ Engineered fill shall not be placed adjacent to concrete less than 7 days after final placement of the concrete UNO
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
○ Engineered fill material shall be compacted by Tamping Rollers and methods approved by the superintendent.
○ In areas where access by such plant is not possible, it shall be compacted by a method approved by a qualified geotechnical engineer.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Check if any culverts or services are with the influence zone for compaction.

○ A general rule, FH will seek advice from the Principles Representative if any culverts, duct banks or RCP pipe are identified closer than 1m from pavement layer surface. If identified, Fulton Hogan will maintain a 1m exclusion zone either side from centre of service for vibrating compaction activities. Hand held DPU’s/whacker plate to be used in lieu of rollers in restricted areas.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, WP SWMS
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Protect area from undue deterioration by;
○ Section off area for at least 12 to 48 hours to allow material to dry back.
○ If unable to do so, keep traffic to a minimum
○ Or ensure any traffic that has to cross pavement layers, do not follow the same driving line.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - On Completion of Density Testing, Proof Roll with either:
– 20 tonne pneumatic tyred roller with individual tyre pressures of not less than 450kpa per tyre.
– 12 tonne static smooth wheeled roller with a load intensity on the wheels of not less than 6 tonne per metre width.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - No point on the surface of each base or subbase layer shall lie more than 10mm below a 3m straightedge laid parallel to the centreline of the pavement
Acceptance Criteria - Pavement layers shall not be less than the design thickness.
Acceptance Criteria - The minimum frequency of field density tests shall be in accordance with VicRoads specification 304 and not less than:
— Base each lot is 5,000 m2 or one day's production
— Sub base each lot is 10,000 m2 or one day's production
○ The minimum number of tests per lot shall be six.
○ Field Dry Density Results shall satisfy the specified values as per the drawings

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
○ Using the correct and complete set of drawings.
○ All drawings are the latest revision
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS and WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Area has been surveyed, highlighting any areas where excavations should not occur (e.g. exclusion zone).
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
○ Submission of APAM supplied recycled crushed concrete 20MM Class 4 to VicRoads Section 812 and TN107
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Aconex Reference
Acceptance Criteria - All plant inducted and inspected as per Fulton Hogan’s plant safety guidelines
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Each Lot of fill must:
○ Not be greater than 300mm in loose layer thickness
○ Be placed in manner where handling and spreading does not produce gradation of the material
○ Where constructing Permanent batters, it shall be overfilled, compacted, and cut back to the dimensions, levels and design grades to ensure the final batters have the required compaction
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

○ Engineered fill material shall be compacted by tamping rollers and methods approved by the Superintendent.  In areas where access by such plant is not possible, it shall be compacted by a Method approved by a qualified geotechnical engineer.
○ Ensure each fill layer has adequate bonding between layers and is free of laminations and discontinuities
Reference Documents - Drawing 00201 Notes E37, E38
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Compact by rolling to achieve a Dry Density not less than the following:
— Greater than 300mm below formation level to MIN 95% SMDD
— Top 300mm below formation level to MIN 98% SMDD (Capping Layer)
○ The minimum frequency of field density tests shall be in accordance with AS 3798 TABLE 8.1 and not less than the following:
— 1 test for each 500m³ volume of compacted fill distributed evenly (minimum 3)
○ Test Certificates to be provided 14 days after completion of each test to the principals representative
Reference Documents - Drawing 00201 Note E33, E40, E43, AS1289 5.8.1
Record of conformity - Test results & This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project/Site Engineer, Principles Rep Foreman
Acceptance Criteria - On Completion of Density Testing, Proof Roll in accordance with AS3798 Section 5.5.
Reference Documents - Drawing 00201 Note E41, AS3798
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
